This was supposed to do great things and make trade fair. What it did in my community is moved several divisions of a major Corporation to Mexico, because of cheap labor....they have since moved to Asia because of cheaper labor. Americans do not want to face the fact that we are now a world economy. In less you want protectionism, their is not much that politicians or Govt. can do. Topic.Title: romney deducted $77,000 for horse care in 2010

Message.Msg: gewizmeto, we are witnessing the results of the INTENTIONAL DUMBING down of America. We are losing a generation of American minds, American students are not learning the skills and knowledge they need to succeed in today’s world. Today, 70 percent of our eighth graders can't read proficiently and most of them will never catch up. Some 1.1 million American high school students drop out every year. Children need knowledge and life-skills to be prepared for life. Adults have an obligation to help children—all children—learn and be prepared for life. Educated people make better neighbors, colleagues, parents and responsible citizens. Quality education is an American “right,” and our children deserve nothing less. Compared to the rest of the world, the state of education in America is disappointing and embarrassing. After World War II, the United States’ had the number 1 high school graduation rate. Today, we have dropped to number 21 among industrialized nations. American students rank 25th in math and 21st in science compared to students in 30 industrialized countries. Even America’s top math students rank 25th out of 30 when compared with the best students across the globe. While America spends more money each year on education, we are losing more and more American students. While we agree that no American student should be left out, written off or ignored, far too many of our poorest and minority students today still lack adequate resources to learn, and the republiCONs DON'T GIVE A D*A*M*N

Message.Msg: It might make you feel better to say that MS Midnite, but dollar for dollar, the rich cost this nation more than all the poor combined. It's not like the poor can afford to fix this nation and it's not like they park their food stamps offshore in tax havens. The rich even give far less to charity per capita than lower earners. If people who claimed to belive in this nation actually honored the previous social contract, things would improve dramatically. I don't remember Grandpa parking any of our millions offshore. Besides, it's harder than ever for poor people to even get any services as their unemployment runs out. Can't but a lot of $77k year dressage horses on that level. Can't write off 80K of a 100k Hum Vee either. Maybe the poor are so lucky everyone should be poor. Volunteers?

I support the right of the owner of the privately owned chicken franchise to have whatever beliefs he possesses. I don't believe in boycotting anybody for political beliefs unless they are harming someone and I don't see any harm here. To me the issue is not gay/lez marriage which I tentatively support. It is the right for people to express their beliefs openly in a pluralistic and democratic society.
